skill.name: doc-generator
skill.description: Generate markdown documentation from Python codebases by analyzing source files, extracting docstrings, type hints, and code structure. Use when the user asks to document Python code, create API docs, or generate README files from source code.
skill.summary: Generate markdown documentation from Python codebases by analyzing source files, extracting docstrin...
skill.author: bossjones

security_audit.summary: The static analysis flagged false positives. The external_commands findings were code examples in markdown backticks, not actual command execution. The weak cryptographic algorithm findings were also false positives - these were markdown code blocks showing example documentation format, not actual crypto usage. This skill only processes Python files to generate documentation.

content.value_statement: Writing documentation is time-consuming and often outdated. This skill analyzes Python codebases to generate comprehensive markdown documentation with docstrings, type hints, and code structure automatically.
actual_capabilities: Extract docstrings from Python modules, classes, and functions
Parse type hints and function signatures automatically
Support multiple docstring formats (Google, NumPy, Sphinx)
Create usage examples from existing code patterns
limitations: Cannot execute or test code examples
Skips private members unless explicitly requested
Requires valid Python syntax for parsing

use_cases.title: Create API Documentation
use_cases.description: Generate comprehensive API documentation from your Python modules with automatic extraction of docstrings and type hints.

use_cases.title: Build README Files
use_cases.description: Create detailed README documentation from your codebase with usage examples and function references.

use_cases.title: Document Legacy Code
use_cases.description: Quickly generate documentation for existing Python projects to understand code structure and functionality.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Documentation
prompt_templates.scenario: Generate docs for a single Python file
prompt_templates.prompt: Create documentation for the Python file at src/utils.py. Include all classes, functions, and their docstrings in markdown format.

prompt_templates.title: API Reference
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate comprehensive API documentation for the myapp/api/ directory. Create a structured reference with all public classes and functions.

prompt_templates.title: README Generator
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the main.py file and generate a README.md with overview, installation, and usage examples based on the code structure.

prompt_templates.title: Documentation Update
prompt_templates.prompt: Update the documentation for src/ directory. Include any new functions added since last documentation and ensure all type hints are captured.

output: HTTP client for external API integration.
- `get(url: str) -> dict`: Fetch data from API endpoint
- `post(url: str, data: dict) -> dict`: Send data to API

best_practices: Write clear docstrings before generating documentation for better output quality
Include type hints in your Python code to enhance generated documentation
Review generated documentation to ensure accuracy and completeness
anti_patterns: Do not rely on generated docs without reviewing - they capture existing content but don't create new explanations
Avoid documenting private functions unless necessary - focus on public APIs
Do not use this as a substitute for writing good docstrings in your code

faq.question: What Python versions are supported?
faq.answer: The skill works with Python 3.6+ files, including modern type hint syntax.

faq.question: Can it generate documentation for private methods?
faq.answer: By default, private members (starting with _) are skipped unless explicitly requested.

faq.question: Does it execute the Python code?
faq.answer: No, it only parses the code structure statically without executing anything.

faq.question: What docstring formats are supported?
faq.answer: Google style, NumPy style, Sphinx style, and plain docstrings are all supported.

faq.question: Can it handle syntax errors in Python files?
faq.answer: Files with syntax errors are skipped with a warning logged.

faq.question: Is the generated documentation customizable?
faq.answer: The skill generates standard markdown that can be edited and customized after generation.
